isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 1: ENGINE CONTROL SYSTEM OVERVIEW - SECTION 1.4: EXHAUST BACK PRESSURE DEVICE - EXHAUST BACK PRESSURE DEVICE (OPTIONAL)

svcproc.title: DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para:
The Exhaust Back Pressure device ( Figure 1.12
) is a mechanism which applies a restriction to the flow of exhaust gas exiting the turbocharger. The increased restriction created by the closure of the butterfly valve increases exhaust back pressure and causes the engine to work harder to force the exhaust gases out of the turbocharger. This results in more heat transferred from the engine to the coolant which allows the cab in the vehicle to receive more heat in a short amount of time.
